This April, Downingtown East juniors Mahitha Penmetsa and Siri Dandu created GirlPlex, an organization providing free coding classes to girls. GirlPlex is focused on closing the gender gap in computer science and aims to support young females in their pursuit of computer science fields in in high school.

It started as one, in-person class last year at the Downingtown Library with approximately 25 middle school girls. It has grown to a series of online coding camps, serving over 200 elementary and middle school students from 11 different states. They have taught HTML, CSS, Javascript, Ruby and Python. The team even held a “students in STEM” college application panel to support rising female seniors interested in a STEM major with their college applications.

Ms. Penmetsa and Ms. Dandu plan to continue their lessons throughout the year and expand their organization to include teaching JAVA and adding Python lessons for high school students.

Learn more here - https://girlplex-website--girlplex.repl.co/index.html

Congratulations, Lauren, for this amazing achievement, and thank you for serving as an outstanding representative of Downingtown Area School District!

Congratulations, Mr. Kreider!

Curious what’s happening at Uwchlan Hills and STEM? Here are a few quick updates.

The new Uwchlan Hills Elementary building is quickly coming together, and is scheduled to be completely enclosed within the next two weeks. Everyone is hard at work with the facility upgrades and looking forward to getting students into their new classrooms!

shared_text:
Uwchlan Township Police Department
October 29, 2019 at 8:56 AM ·

Halloween Safety

Please Trick-or-treat only between the hours of 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm Thursday evening, October 31, 2019, and visit only those homes with an outdoor light on.

Please be reminded of these safety tips:

· Parents should accompany children on their rounds. If a parent isn’t available, someone the parents trust should go with the children.

· Children should walk on the sidewalk, not in the road, when possible. They should walk facing oncoming traffic, and cross streets only at crosswalks, not between cars.

· Children should avoid wearing masks that obstruct their vision.

· Costumes should be flame retardant and fit properly.

· Children should wear reflective clothing or patches on their costumes.

· Make sure your flash light has fresh batteries in it and use it at all times while walking.

· Parents should check treats before they are eaten.

· Parents should report any suspicious activity to local police.

Everyone have fun and be safe!

Mrs. Savastio's 2nd grade class at Shamona Creek Elementary School was treated to a visit from Superintendent Lonardi, Board Member Colleen Cranney, Board President Jane Bertone, DASD parent and webmaster Pia DiSanto and Mrs. DiSanto's monarch caterpillars. 🦋

Over the years, Mrs. DiSanto has raised and donated hundreds of caterpillars to DASD classes. Students will learn about and experience firsthand the metamorphosis of a monarch - from egg to caterpillar to chrysalis to butterfly!

In 2014, the US Fish and Wildlife Service petitioned to protect the monarch butterfly under the Endangered Species Act. The final ruling won't be made until 2020, but in the meantime, Mrs. DiSanto and Mrs. Savastio's class will be helping to support the butterfly's diminishing population!
